text: Hello, how are you all? Welcome to Chai Aur Code and we are continuing our Django series it's quite fun In this video, we will extend the series a little more First time we will hit some documentation of Django officially and one of the most important thing is Jinja Now what is this new word here? Jinja version 2 is used in Django by default There are many other templating engines but I have rarely seen a company which changes the default templating engine and brings in another engine in Django All the production grade apps are mostly run in Jinja and all the developers like Jinja because you don't have to add any further extension we write normal HTML files where we have to inject variables or loop something then it is injected directly in the HTML file By default, the extension of Django which you can install in VS Code gives you a good boilerplate and makes the work easier so that's why people like Jinja a lot After that, we will see one more thing in this video that how apps are made In Django, the default project you have which is settings.py file and all we don't work on that much every work is done in a separate app Whenever you see a production level app or any app at least one app is made in it even if you are making a website bare minimum but at least one app is made whether you are making a post, blogging platform, social media platform e-commerce, whatever you are making at least one app is made When you make a project in Django you make a project only once after that you never make it again at least during that time you can make multiple projects obviously but the command to run the project once is the start project after that you will always run the start app multiple apps can be in Django in fact, it is So, we will talk about all these things in today's video Let's also take a comment target First of all, if you haven't subscribed yet then do it fast how long will you not do it? We are sitting here If you are coming here then subscribe we will also get a motivation apart from that, our comment target not much let's take a target of 300 comments we have to complete it in 24 hours then we will consider it as a target achievement otherwise, then see we feel a little heartbroken that we are working so hard we are not getting comments we are getting very less share so don't do that do it fast it doesn't take much money it takes less okay let's go with you first of all, we will go to documentation Django's documentation is a very interesting documentation but I think the font size is a little small by default or maybe I am the only one who is used to seeing big fonts so you will go to this you don't need to go to first apps and image you just scroll here you will get different layers how is the documentation organized model layer, view layer we will come to these too now where we want to go is our template layer as soon as you go to the overview of the template layer then you will get here how is Django project configured you can use several template engines in this the most common template engine is DTL Django Template Language and then it is popularly called Jinja as soon as you go to Jinja then you will get this yes, it has a little Japanese touch so Jinja is Fast, Expressive, Extensible Template Language whatever APIs you want to read about Jinja you can read from here if you want to read about high level APIs then here you will get how are the blocks, how is the end string, start string how to apply loops by the way, in the comment section and description I have given a link of a blog article which is available on IOR code in that I have written about all the templates or blocks of Jinja so you can read that too you should read it I have written it in a very organized structure now let's come back to our Django documentation how is Django template language now you will see syntax in the basic page the syntax of Django is very good now you will see where ever you want to insert variables you can insert variables in double curly braces you will see two major syntax one is double curly braces syntax and one syntax where you use one curly braces and one % sign for variables you use double curly braces you always use double curly braces but you will see some places where you use % sign like here, CSRF token we will talk about this too now you will see that we have used some places like here by the way, this is Django extension you can install it that's why I have opened it so that you can see I have opened this extension I will tell you a small setting which is almost necessary in VS Code otherwise you won't get suggestions of HTML I will tell you that too so you will see when we worked on index.html we used % sign load static earlier we didn't have any color feedback after this I installed Django extension usually when I teach Django I uninstall it first time then I install it here it's been a long time since I took bootcamp but we do it like this because there were no variables here you want to load some settings you want to load some special syntax then you can load static like this you are using curly braces and % sign in documentation, the blog article I have written I have told you about these things when it is static, when you want to load something if else, how to use for loop you can read all that we will use it too you will get to know about it so there is nothing to worry there is nothing else there is a small option you can also do piping of things like in upper case and lower case we can also do values like this many times we do it like this it's a very common syntax comments are also given here how to use engines read a little bit as we move forward you will get to know more how we work and how it works so first of all go and read a little the article I have written after so much hard work now we will see how further apps are made in Django because till now the thing I have told you consider it as a directory structure overview we have not done anything special just rendered it with an HTML file now we will see how Django apps are made how they look and how they work so first of all we will open our terminal so let's close it now I am in my environment variable I am in virtual environment first of all my work is to do ls and see if manage.py file is visible if it is not visible then open it and see if it is visible now I have manage.py file if it is not visible then you will not be able to make apps through this file only your server runs through this file only your apps are made the way to make apps is very simple through python we will run manage.py which command to run like run server is a command similarly you have start app if it was create app then it would be better but who are we to judge start app is a starting point of your project it creates the app it is not necessary that you create the app in this way you can do it manually many
